item.title: Summary - Hurricane Jose (AT2/AL122017)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...JOSE STILL A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO PRODUCE DANGEROUS SURF AND RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE EAST COAST OF THE UNITED STATES FOR SEVERAL MORE DAYS... As of 8:00 AM EDT Tue Sep 19 the center of Jose was located near 36.3, -71.6 with movement N at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 973 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 75 mph.

nhc:Cyclone.nhc:name: Jose
nhc:Cyclone.nhc:headline: ...JOSE STILL A CATEGORY 1 HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO PRODUCE DANGEROUS SURF AND RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE EAST COAST OF THE UNITED STATES FOR SEVERAL MORE DAYS...

item.title: Summary - Hurricane Maria (AT5/AL152017)
item.author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
item.description: ...POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC HURRICANE MARIA HEADED FOR THE VIRGIN ISLANDS AND PUERTO RICO... As of 8:00 AM AST Tue Sep 19 the center of Maria was located near 16.2, -62.8 with movement WNW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 933 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 160 mph.

nhc:Cyclone.nhc:name: Maria
nhc:Cyclone.nhc:headline: ...POTENTIALLY CATASTROPHIC HURRICANE MARIA HEADED FOR THE VIRGIN ISLANDS AND PUERTO RICO...
